title: LangeTwins 2014 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine is worth exploring. It's made from a grape variety popular in Italy and has attractive earth and sage aromas and cherry flavors liberally sprinkled with mineral and leather accents. A light coating of tannins boosts the mouthfeel.

title: Nodland 2013 Private Blend Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This blend of all six Bordeaux varieties is lighter in color and offers wound-up aromas of savory herb, char, exotic spice, green pepper and cherry. The flavors are light and silky in feel, intertwining with charry barrel notes on the lingering finish.

title: Olivini 2016  Lugana
description: Aromas of white wild flower and golden apple waft out of the glass while the juicy palate offers Bartlett pear and a hint of nectarine. Fresh acidity gives it a tangy finish.

title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2015 Mafra Riesling (Lisboa)
description: This Riesling, from vineyards close to the Atlantic Ocean, boasts white fruit and mineral characters. It's a taut, textured wine, with intense acidity and great fruitiness that is beginning to mature. Drink now.

title: Pedroncelli 2014 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Smoky leather and cedar notes rest on a brawny foundation of bold, dry tannin and generous black fruit in this dusty wine. Full-bodied and dense, it opens to show additional tobacco and chocolate aspects.

title: Rutherford Hill 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Punchy red fruit meets brawny tannin and substantial oak in this red, which includes small amounts of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Its cherry and cassis notes are seasoned with dried herb highlights.

title: Seufert 2012 Vine Idyl Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Slightly sweet flavors of concentrated strawberry preserves create a rather thick mouthfeel. It's a jammy style of Pinot, to be sure, but with just enough supporting acidity to keep it from crumbling under its own weight. Drink over the next two or three years.

title: Seven Falls 2014 GPS Series Mracheck Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
description: Baking spice, vanilla and dark-fruit aromas are followed by dark cherry and coffee flavors that linger on the finish. The barrel influence seems a little intense.

title: Seven Hills 2014 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of moist earth, black fruit, pencil lead and slightly overripe red apple are followed by a firm palate backed by lightly grippy tannins. This wine needs some food to keep them in check.

title: Soos Creek 2014 Artist Series #14 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 62% Cabernet Sauvignon and 38% Cabernet Franc. Barrel aromas are at the fore, with baking spice, woodspice and clove in front of dark fruit and herb. The palate brings sweet, sappy fruit flavors, with plentiful licorice and game accents.

title: Starmont 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made to be approachable, this full-bodied red is juicy with black fruit and tart cherry flavors, with a savory side of gunpowder and tobacco. Firm, integrated tannins behave well in the background.

title: Renegade 2016 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A pretty pale-peach color, this wine is a blend of Syrah (69%), Cinsault (15%), Grenache (9%) and Mourvèdre. Pleasing aromas of wild strawberry and watermelon lead to tart, dry drinking flavors with a mouthwatering, orange-rind-filled finish.

title: Venica & Venica 2015 Ronco del Cerò Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This opens with subtle aromas suggesting white flower, hay and dried aromatic herb. The medium-bodied palate offers juicy yellow peach and a hint of grapefruit while a salty hint of mineral marks the close.

title: William Church 2014 Keystone Series Lewis Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of cola, herb, barrel spice and cherry lead to plentiful cola flavors. The palate brings some heft but the tannins possess a slight sense of grittiness that distracts.

title: Stoller 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Dundee Hills)
description: This bone-dry high-acid wine puts flavors of grapefruit flesh and rind front and center. It's a no-fuss summer sipper, perhaps not quite as rich as previous vintages, or maybe just exceptionally young. It's tangy, fresh and focused.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Umpqua Valley)
description: Packed with fresh flavors of ripe grapefruit, this palate-cleaning Sauvignon Blanc is a nice match for simple dishes such as boneless chicken breast pan-fried in olive oil. Wet stone minerality underscores the vivid acids.

title: Sweetzer Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lemon curd, white peach and tangerine aromas make for a nicely rounded nose in this appellation blend. It's a very familiar Chardonnay expression on the palate, with a citrus edge that cuts through ripe pear and sea salt flavors. The mouthfeel shows chalky tension.

title: Sanguinhal 2014 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Obidos)
description: Situated close to the picturesque hilltop town of Obidos, this quinta has produced a ripe full-bodied wine. With bold red fruits, juicy acidity and a layer of tannins, the wine is both generous and fruity. It will be ready to drink from late 2017.

title: Three Rivers 2012 Svelte Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc, 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec. Aromas of baking spice, red and black fruit and sweet spices are followed by dark-fruit flavors. The tannins come off as a bit dry and burly at present.

title: C R Graybehl 2015 Mounts Family Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Waxy in mouthfeel and dark gold in color, this wine offers simple fresh lemon and green apple flavors, its finish expansive and full.

title: Cambria 2015 Clone 4 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This wine—part of the “Seeds of Empowerment” fundraising series benefitting female do-gooders around the world—is light in the glass, crisp on the nose and laced with lime blossom, lemon peel, wet stone and Gala apple scents. Its shows bracing freshness on the palate through key lime, white peach and Asian pear flavors.

title: Cameron Hughes 2014 Lot 604 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Soft, smoky oak permeates this full-bodied wine, with light clove and cinnamon accents. The rich layers of blackberry and black currant fruit are complemented by mocha notes.

title: Château Lamothe de Haux 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine is tight, crisp with citrus flavors and intense acidity. It is developing into a refreshing, broader wine that will convey a riper character. Just wait until late 2017.

title: Château Le Giron 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Offering both herbal acidity and delicious spiciness, this wine is balanced, grassy and also ripe. It is a fruity, modern style, ready to drink now.

title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Tight while fruity, this is going to be an attractive wine from the Gadras family, who have owned the property since the early 19th century. With its layers of citrus acidity and richer pear and apples, it is packed with fruit that's given added interest by spice. Drink from late 2017.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Beverly Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: On first pour, the aromas of toast, char, spice and herb show some reduction that blows off over time. The purple-fruit flavors are lighter in style, showing a pleasing sense of purity, with the concentration dipping in the middle before coming back together on the finish.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Découverte Riesling (Alsace)
description: A very tropical nose that even has a touch of passion fruit leads onto a very fresh easy fruit-driven palate. Lemon and tart orange characterize the aromas on the light, dry and fresh body. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.

title: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2013 Negre Red (Terra Alta)
description: Ripe, slightly oxidized berry, raisin and Band-Aid aromas feed a tannic, grippy palate in this Garnacha, Syrah and Carignan blend. Its earthy berry and plum flavors are full and ripe, with a blocky, slightly medicinal finish.

title: Chacewater 2014 Highlander Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a rich-textured, full-bodied wine with lots of dark fruit flavors and thick tannins softened by a touch of sweetness. It has a very dark color, strawberry and blackberry aromas and darker, more concentrated flavors including dark chocolate and blueberry.

title: Château la Freynelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Aromatic and floral, this wine has crisp fruitiness and lively acidity that support the delicious spicy character. Drink now.
